properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 5 at 4:32PM EST until February 7 at 4:25PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood
Advisory for the Congaree River...

Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland
Counties

.Rainfall amounts from 3 to 5 inches are expected over the next
24 hours across the Broad River and Santee River Basins. This
combined with reservoir operations will produce rapid rises along
the Congaree River at Columbia Thursday through Friday.

The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a
* Flood Advisory for
The Congaree River At Columbia.
* until Friday afternoon.
* At  4 PM Wednesday the stage was 6.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise to crest at 16.9 feet Saturday
evening.
* Advisory stage is 10.0 feet.
* At 16.0 feet...Old State Road, SC 66, below Cayce becomes flooded.
* At 14.0 feet...Roads in low lying areas and swampland downstream
from Columbia become flooded. Most of the Cayce and West Columbia
river walk is flooded.
* At 13.0 feet...Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and
downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the
Cayce and West Columbia river walk.
* At 10.0 feet...Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and
downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the
Cayce and West Columbia river walk.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means that nuisance flooding may occur nearest the
river when the level is below the official flood stage.
